comments.text:
+CoNiggyFresh It's a lot more human than this:

" *Dragging. This method is best accomplished in a desolate place, as it 
sometimes arouses compassion in unrelated observers. With your dog on its 
leash, attach the free end to your car's bumper or to the rear 
undercarriage of your vehicle. Once done, get in your car and begin to 
drive at high speed. Five minutes will probably do the trick. If not, try 
and other five. Remember to remove any gravel that may lodge in the dog's 
flesh afterwards.* "

http://www.cookyourpet.com/html/euthanasia.htm

comments.author: CoNiggyFresh

comments.text:
+Johnny NoGooD  " *grow a pair. I can tell you some horror stories about 
being abused.* "

Fuck off asshole. 

It's all fun and games until you actually see results of abuse.  I had a 
dog in rescue that was so terrified of me, he wouldn't defecate or urinate 
if I was visible, because he was ruthlessly beaten whenever he did, because 
his previous owners never house trained him.

They just viscously beat him whenever he went to the bathroom, to the point 
he was afraid to do it.  He had no idea it was OK to go outside.

His skull was broken when I got him.  It healed, but irregularly.

When I got him, I would take him outside, tie him to a post, and go inside 
so he could relive himself.

That's what people are like.  Not enough people, but plenty.

I often regret not keeping that dog.  My actual dog hated him, because he 
bit me when I was trying to comb him out.  When he bit me, he immediately 
defecated, expecting to be beaten near to death.  I gained his trust, I was 
first person he ever trusted.
comments.author: fuzzywzhe

comments.text:
+fuzzywzhe grow a pair. I can tell you some horror stories about being 
abused. It doesn't mean I get to act like things are not funny or that I 
know more about certain situations ya tool.
comments.author: Johnny NoGooD

comments.text:
+samantha Heath It would be a joke, if it was funny.

I did dog rescue, if you did the same, you would have seen what I have.  
People can be incredibly cruel, because they think of animals as a thing, 
not a living entity.

I've had 2 dogs in rescue which were horribly abused.  They adored me for 
the only reason I wasn't cruel to them.  I was the first person in their 
life to show them a human being wasn't a monster.

Gaining their trust that I wasn't going to hurt them was the most difficult 
part.  The second most difficult mission was to show them that their first 
owner was a freak, not a normal person - it was giving them trust in 
humanity in general.

This is all giggles and laughs until you see the outcome of cruelty.

This is like making jokes about child abuse to me.  It's all abstract until 
you realize there really are people like this.
comments.author: fuzzywzhe

top_comment.text:
A WARNING TO ALL THOSE BRAVE OR STUPID ENOUGH TO VISIT THE COMMENT SECTION: 
 Whenever you see somebody post a link, do not click it.  However, it is 
human nature that our curiosity often overwhelms our instincts, so here's 
some steps to take in case you absolutely must know what the link leads to. 
  

1) Turn your speakers/headphones off.  Shit's most likely going to get 
loud, inappropriate, or both.   
2) DO NOT just click the link.  Right click it and hit "Open Link in New 
Tab."  This will give you a chance to read the page title and see if your 
still curious.   
3) If the tab you opened says "Go To Sleep!" Close it WITHOUT LOOKING AT IT 
and thank god you didn't have to hire a therapist.   
4) If it says anything other than that, be wary.  Seriously, brace yourself 
because it's probably some other scary shit or the grossest most fucked up 
kind of porn imaginable.   

Note:  If whatever you clicked on turns out to just be spam, thank god 
because it could be so, SSOOOO much worse﻿

comments.text:
+Der Grossmann Ah , yes , when I wrote " raised animals " I did mean to 
imply animals raised specifically for that purpose . I suppose I should 
have been clearer .
And I have no ideal it's illegal to do that in the US , that's interesting .
Regarding those " exotic delicacies " , utterly and resoundingly yes . 
There's absolutely no reason good enough to justify torturing the animals 
like that before eating them ( and what's worst is that , sometimes , the 
process is actually part of the bloody " experience " ) . They die for our 
food , for God's sake . The least we can do is to have some respect .
comments.author: Aoi Cao

comments.text:
There is if it's illegal in the country you live in (it's illegal in 
America to slaughter cats/ dogs for delicacies), and not socially 
acceptable, because it's just as disrespectful and discriminating against 
one's eating habits in their home country. And it's not just the 
illegalities, it's how they carry out the cruelty. It's commonly found that 
throughout certain Chinese provinces (not all), that the animals are 
purposefully butchered while still alive so the hormones that are 
responsibly excreted during highly stressful situations "enhance the meat's 
flavor". A few articles about that, actually, not just rumor. Then again, 
the site being featured in this particular video seems extremely satirical.
comments.author: Der Grossmann

comments.text:
+Der Grossmann Yep , I basically have no further knowledge than that they 
are usually not eaten for some reason or other ( evidences point toward the 
ideal that the religious standpoint actually started out as a way to 
discourage people from eating them , because in countries where people 
follow Islam the climate is such that a pig's meat is not worth the 
resources used to raise it , and in India people desperately need cow to 
plough . But anyway . )
My point still stands , though . There's no  reason to discriminate against 
people for eating raised animals .
comments.author: Aoi Cao

comments.text:
+Aoi Cao Lol, Aoi, you obviously have no clue about Islam, then. Pigs 
aren't eaten because they're deemed "unclean", not because they're sacred. 
Also, India, being rather corrupt in its social standing, has many 
individuals that "follow Hinduism" which have little regard for cattle and 
are quick to make a buck by starving them so their loose-fitted skin can be 
used for leather.

captions.text:
Hey Vsauce I'm Jake and DON'T POP IT.com,
so instead let's just wait...ok...this is

taking too long (2). What does the Rap board
have to say...okaaay well luckily I have a

lot more DONGs just for you...things you can
do online now, guys.

Every last drop goes through every last fact
about water usage in the UK with an awesome

animation to go along with it....for example
⅓ of water is lost in leaky pipes before
it even gets to our homes.

Or virtually leave your home and see the sights
of Tokyo. This 150 gigapixel image was shot

from the top of Tokyo tower over 2 days, is
made up of 10,000 images and it took 12 weeks
to stitch together.

Then explore more of Japan by hiking the summit
of Mt. Fuji using Google Street View.

But instead of exploring photos, turn them
8bit with Super Pixel Time. You upload whatever
image you want, set the style and let it pixelate.

If you'd rather make something from scratch
check out Neon Flames that lets you paint

with said flames. Choose your color and the
longer you hold the mouse down the more intense

the light becomes. Soon enough you'll have
a master piece like this...

And while you're being artistic, listen to
wikipedia. Bells indicate an addition to an

article and strings represent a subtraction.
The change of pitch depends on the size of

the edit, and new users create a beautiful
swell. Clicking on any of the dots will take

you to it's corresponding page and the whole
thing is quite soothing.

For something even more relaxing there's ("WHAT")...ug...for
something ("WHAT")....Lil Jon you're very
annoying ("YEAH!").

Ya know what? Let's Human Chop, a fun gruesome
flash game where you chop down large objects
and crush the little guys beneath.

Ah, I feel better now so lets check out a
game Mr. Orange Paper sent me called Sinuous.

You have to avoid the endless waves of red
dots and grab power ups. It seems easy at
first and then, well.... you die.

Boooooo.....tube. Bootube takes away all the
awesome videos (like vsauce), and feeds you
only the worst rated ones on YouTube.

Speaking of feeding, I'm getting hungry, mind
if I cook your pet.com? They have plenty of

recipes and who could resist a vanilla sundae
with dog blo...you know what...I'm good...I'm
good.

I'm just going to go play Icarus Proudbottom
Teaches Typing, an amazing game that not only

makes typing fun, it makes it awesome. From
Holy Wow Studios, Icarus Proudbottom instructs

you with hilarious fictitious facts about
typing and then proceeds to shame you when
you perform poorly.

Once you've become king (or queen) of the
keyboard, use this great website to draw with

text. Pick your font, the size and the words
and draw away. Then have it all translated

by R2D2 (Jake, you are so strong and handsome).
Oh, R2, you always know just what to say.

But I don't when it comes to computer jargon,
which is why I use the Hollywood Tech Jargon
generator.

Then I have Emoji tracker keep tabs on every
emoji used on twitter in real time.... Awww
hearts are the most popular, humanity is saved.

And it is all thanks to this penguin that
hollowichigo56778 showed me from the game

Ripple Dot Zero. You play a genetically modified
battle penguin that kills bad guys to escape

the laboratory that has imprisoned his flightless
little body.

If you're trying to escape it helps to have
the key..chords... a great tool that lets

musicians learn new chords and progressions
without having to go back to school for music

theory. Add the chords you want to try and
see how it sounds, then pick your favorite
and learn a new song.

It's a zip, a fun game that has you as a tiny
adorable creature jumping through multi colored

boxes making your way to the target. Be careful
not to be the same color as the bottom block

or you'll fall to your death. Your horrible,
horrible death.

But it's hard to be down when you're playing
with this thing. I have no idea what it is,
but it's really cool.

Use the Daylight Hours Explorer to see how
many hours of sun you'll receive on a specified

date and latitude. The closer you get the
poles the more disparity there is between
night and day.

No matter what time of day you can always
be Hunting Arrows. You have to direct your

colored arrows away from the black ones or
else they get splattered onto the backdrop.

Send me your DONGs via a YouTube Message or
on my Facebook. I'm Jake and
as always, thanks for watching.
